p: Some important compound formulations are also prescribed during epidemics. Ibn Rushd (1126–1198 CE) has given a description of a medicine, about which he made a curious claim, ‘ whoever has used this formulation during an epidemic remained protected from it’. The composition is as follows: Sibr ( Aloe vera L.) and Murr makki ( Commiphora myrrha Nees Engl.), one part each, za'fran ( Crocus sativus L.), 2 parts. The drugs should be finely powdered and taken in a dose of 2.4 g per day ( Rushd, 1987). For epidemics involving respiratory diseases, gargling with a solution of sumaq ( Rhus coriaria L., decoction), rub-e-toot ( Morus nigra L.), rub-e-jauz ( Juglans regia L.) and arq-e-gulab ( Rosa damascena Herrm.) before sleep is advised ( Razi, 1991). Information about the use of these drugs is provided in Table 2 .
